For a Low Spec/ Noob Skill Level player. This is the CS to play. I own CS, CS CZ, CSS, and CS GO. Out of them all CSS is definately my go to game.

I use bots and play offline, aka on my own server. The bots are less clever than CS CZ and a little less accurate, giving me time to have fun and be liesure. Especially since this version allows players a console option to modify health number.

Nice graphics, similar to HL2. Smooth character images, even on low settings. Doesn't take up a whole lot of memory space.

Buy for cheap and you will be satisfied.

Here it is, one of my favorite FPS games! Here is a review! (This is similar to my Counter-Strike 1.6 review following the same structured script, but I added more to this!)

Brief Summary
~~~~~~~~~~~~
The series began on Windows in 1999 with this game, Counter-Strike. Though, originally a modification for Half-Life, the rights to Counter-Strike, as well as the developers working on it, were acquired by Valve Corporation in 2000. Following the footsteps of Counter Strike 1.6 and Condition Zero, on November 1st, 2004, we get a new installment fixing our critiques, and growing larger than the predecessors! Lets move on to the gameplay shall we?

The gameplay
~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Counter-Strike series is an objective-based, multiplayer fps (First Person Shooter). Two opposing teams‚Äîthe Terrorists and the Counter Terrorists‚Äîcompete in game modes to complete objectives, such as securing a location to plant or defuse a bomb and rescuing or guarding hostages. You win money by winning the rounds, and with that money, you can buy weapons to defeat enemies faster, or slower. Killing the opposite teammates result in extra cash, but attempting to attack your teammates will result in punishments. Punishments may be, being kicked from the game, being killed, and loosing money. Think twice!

Pros (Warning, very similar pros to the first, it really turned those cons into pros huh?)
~~~~~
1. The community is regarded as less toxic, more friendly and mature, and over all chill people who are fun to talk to.
2. Easier controls.
3. Its not free to play (because thats a pro again I guess?)
4. It's a nice get together with friends! Like previously stated.
5. Less horrendously bad microphone quality users 
6. No loot crates!
7. No gimmicky features!
8. Counter Strike 1.6, but upgraded graphics, better FPS, and more people playing!

Cons
~~~~~
1. It's players decreased since 2004, it's old yes, so it makes since. You don't walk into someones house and see an atari 2600. (I mean you might lol)


Final Judgement
+~+~+~+~+~+~+~
I give this game a solid 9/10. It has a flaw here or there, but seriously. CS:GO but, less gimmicky, less system requirements, and just over all a better community. Yes, I recommend it.
If this is the source of Counter Strike, why isn't this the first game in the franchise? tough question.

This is my favourite cs game.
The game may not have the best mechanics or guns but at least its fun.I like that the game is fully runned by the community and thanks to the engine there are pretty fun gamemodes like surf, bhop, hide and seek,mini games(my fav) and ect. The only weird thing about the game is that the head hitboxes are massive so always aim for the head. I definitely recommend this game.I give it a solid 9.5/10
